exercise-tasks.description: Create a simple table called Sample with ID (Integer) as the primary key and Description as a text column
exercise-tasks.verify-query: CREATE TABLE Sample (ID INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, Description TEXT);

exercise-tasks.description: Write a CREATE TABLE statement for a table named Continents with columns ContinentID (INTEGER), Name (TEXT), Size (INTEGER), and CountryCount (INTEGER). Ensure CountryID is a primary key and auto-increments. Make Name, Size and CountryCount NOT NULL.
exercise-tasks.verify-query: CREATE TABLE Continents (ContinentID INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, Name TEXT NOT NULL, Size INTEGER NOT NULL, CountryCount INTEGER NOT NULL);
exercise-tasks.chatgpt-prompt:
Explain why this SQL query correctly creates a table named Continents with the specified constraints. How does AUTOINCREMENT work with PRIMARY KEY for ContinentID? Why are Name, Size, and CountryCount marked as NOT NULL? How does this structure enforce data integrity and ensure every continent has the required information?

Correct query:
CREATE TABLE Continents (
  ContinentID INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
  Name TEXT NOT NULL,
  Size INTEGER NOT NULL,
  CountryCount INTEGER NOT NULL
);
